name: DoubleTree by Hilton London Ealing

reviews.text: We stayed for three days, two nights. Had to get two rooms because they do not have family rooms. The breakfast was decent, coffee was delicious. The rooms are small but clean. Its less than five minutes from underground station and about ten minutes walk to an area full of restaurants, grocery stores, and inexpensive shopping. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Clean, Professional Staff, Affordable prices

reviews.text: Lets see:
reviews.title: The Right hand didn't know what the Left hand was doing....

reviews.text: * small bathrooms where you have to close the door in order to get into the bath tub with a slanted wash basin, so water went onto the floor every time you used the sink.
reviews.title: Okay but could do better...

reviews.text: * Staff that are unsure and inconsistant with their answers. My colleague arrived before me, gave the reception staff my name so they checked her into my room. When I arrived they informed me that I don't have a booking. I showed them my booking reservation, they couldnt find. I asked after my colleague by name, "no she hast arrived ". They checked me into a room until they followed it up, only to tell me later that evening that my colleague was staying in the room next to me.
reviews.title: The worst in West London

reviews.text: * Payment issues, I pre paid but they wanted to double charge me. They also took my colleague's credit card details.
reviews.title: Not bad but a long way from the centre

reviews.text: I have stayed in a lot of hotels around Ealing with my work and this is by far my favorite. The location is great being next to Ealing town and it's near the London circular and the M1.
reviews.title: Excellent staff great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are a good size and always clean.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant has a good selection and the food is tasty. (Has a good home comforts section.)
reviews.title: London Best Buy?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the staff. They are much friendlier than other hotels and are always happy to help. Special thanks to Hema Govind who provided exceptional service!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - Will Use All The Time

reviews.text: Hopefully be back soon
reviews.title: Friendly and helpful staff, clean, free wifi in reception area, 2 minutes to Ealing Common tube...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 1 night for the Hyde Park concerts. Surprised at the poor reviews as we felt it was pretty good for a "chain" hotel. Ealing Common tube station 200 metres away, ample cheap parking (by London standards - £6 per 24 hrs). Our room was clean, modern and had everything we needed. Would recommend it for a access to west London (Hyde park 15 mins on tube).
reviews.title: An okay stay

reviews.text: My company could not find a reasonably priced hotel in central London for a recent business trip. They were going to book a hotel near Heathrow. The Heathrow hotel would have been very inconvenient as you have to pay for shuttle to get you to and from airport and that is how I would have accessed the tube. I found this hotel online and requested it instead. It isn't as convenient as staying in Kensington where the company usually places me but it was fine. The tube station is a 5 minute, safe walk, across street, 2 blocks to left. The Paddington and District lines run frequently.
reviews.title: better than airport hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself was more than adequate. My room was bigger and more modern than the one in Kensington. Carpet was clean, bathroom was nice with plenty of thick, nice towels. The front desk staff were very welcoming. The manager told me the hotel is about to be remodeled. I did not have breakfast but did get ice from bar for cold water. Coffee and tea in the room.
reviews.title: Stressed staff, noisy and coach loads of unsupervised children

reviews.text: I ate at the Portuguese restaurant on the corner by tube stop. It was a good meal at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: What a deal

reviews.text: It was easy to get from and to the airport on the Paddington line. It took less time to get into central London on the Dstrict line than the Paddington line.
reviews.title: Breakfast good, but little else

reviews.text: We have recently enjoyed short stay at this hotel. We booked two nights (Fri/Sat) for £118 per room; based on my research this seemed to be pretty good value when compared with other London hotels.
reviews.title: Good location for a visit to london

reviews.text: We found the hotel very easy to get too (when traveling from the South West of England) and parking here was not a problem (costing £6 for 24 hours, although the price has now increased to £10 for 24 hours). We had no problems during our stay.
reviews.title: friendly and efficient staff

reviews.text: The hotel is very well located for a trip into central London, with the tude station only a very short walk away. We were also able to walk to Ealing Broadway (about 15 minutes away) for shops, restaurants and pubs!
reviews.title: Ideal location for visitors to London

reviews.text: Overall a good stay.
reviews.title: A completely average experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we recently stayed at this hotel while my 8 year old son alfie was filming a commercial
reviews.title: Would stay again

description: Our warm and inviting London - Ealing Hotel boasts an ideal location in the quiet suburb of Ealing, offering transportation links to both central London and Wembley Stadium. Enjoy easy access to a range of fantastic dining, shopping and entertainment opportunities from our convenient Ealing hotel. We are also situated within close proximity to a number of businesses and colleges, including the University of West London.Indulge in afternoon tea or sip delicious, pre-dinner cocktails at the chic and stylish W5 Grill & Bar, where you can enjoy a sophisticated dining experience and a selection of grilled specialties and fine wines.Host a meeting at this Ealing hotel in one of our flexible meeting rooms or celebrate a special occasion in our attractive event space. Let our professional banquet staff organize your dream wedding reception or important business event.
